00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the hardware Packet Output unit.
00044  *
00045  * Starting with SDK 1.7.0, the PKO output functions now support
00046  * two types of locking. CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG continues to
00047  * function similarly to previous SDKs by using POW atomic tags
00048  * to preserve ordering and exclusivity. As a new option, you
00049  * can now pass CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE which uses a ll/sc
00050  * memory based locking instead. This locking has the advantage
00051  * of not affecting the tag state but doesn't preserve packet
00052  * ordering. CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE is appropriate in most
00053  * generic code while CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE should be used
00054  * with hand tuned fast path code.
00055  *
00056  * Some of other SDK differences visible to the command command
00057  * queuing:
00058  * - PKO indexes are no longer stored in the FAU. A large
00059  *   percentage of the FAU register block used to be tied up
00060  *   maintaining PKO queue pointers. These are now stored in a
00061  *   global named block.
00062  * - The PKO <b>use_locking</b> parameter can now have a global
00063  *   effect. Since all application use the same named block,
00064  *   queue locking correctly applies across all operating
00065  *   systems when using CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE.
00066  * - PKO 3 word commands are now supported. Use
00067  *   cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish3().
00068  *
00069  */
00070 
00071 #ifndef __CVMX_HWPKO_H__
00072 #define __CVMX_HWPKO_H__
00073

00101 /* Adjust the command buffer size by 1 word so that in the case of using only
00102 ** two word PKO commands no command words stradle buffers.  The useful values
00103 ** for this are 0 and 1. */
00104 #define CVMX_PKO_COMMAND_BUFFER_SIZE_ADJUST (1)
00105 
00106 
00107 #define CVMX_PKO_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES_STATIC 256
00108 #define CVMX_PKO_MAX_OUTPUT_QUEUES      ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN31XX) || \
00109                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN3010) || \
00110                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN3005) || \
00111                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN50XX)) ? \
00112                       32 :                  \
00113                      (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN58XX) || \
00114                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN56XX) || \
00115                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN52XX) || \
00116                       OCTEON_IS_OCTEON2() || \
00117                       OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX)) ? \
00118                       256 : 128)
00119 #define CVMX_PKO_NUM_OUTPUT_PORTS       ((OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN63XX)) ? 44 : (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN66XX) ? 48 : 40))
00120 #define CVMX_PKO_MEM_QUEUE_PTRS_ILLEGAL_PID 63  /* use this for queues that are not used */
00121 #define CVMX_PKO_QUEUE_STATIC_PRIORITY  9
00122 #define CVMX_PKO_ILLEGAL_QUEUE  0xFFFF
00123 #define CVMX_PKO_MAX_QUEUE_DEPTH 0
00124 
00125 typedef enum {
00126     CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS,
00127     CVMX_PKO_INVALID_PORT,
00128     CVMX_PKO_INVALID_QUEUE,
00129     CVMX_PKO_INVALID_PRIORITY,
00130     CVMX_PKO_NO_MEMORY,
00131     CVMX_PKO_PORT_ALREADY_SETUP,
00132     CVMX_PKO_CMD_QUEUE_INIT_ERROR
00133 } cvmx_pko_return_value_t;
00134 
00135 /**
00136  * This enumeration represents the differnet locking modes supported by PKO.
00137  */
00138 typedef enum {
00139     CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE = 0,
00140                     /**< PKO doesn't do any locking. It is the responsibility
00141                                         of the application to make sure that no other core is
00142                                         accessing the same queue at the same time */
00143     CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG = 1,
00144                     /**< PKO performs an atomic tagswitch to insure exclusive
00145                                         access to the output queue. This will maintain
00146                                         packet ordering on output */
00147     CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE = 2,
00148                     /**< PKO uses the common command queue locks to insure
00149                                         exclusive access to the output queue. This is a memory
00150                                         based ll/sc. This is the most portable locking
00151                                         mechanism */
00152 } cvmx_pko_lock_t;
00153 
00154 typedef struct cvmx_pko_port_status {
00155     uint32_t packets;
00156     uint64_t octets;
00157     uint64_t doorbell;
00158 } cvmx_pko_port_status_t;
00159 
00160 /**
00161  * This structure defines the address to use on a packet enqueue
00162  */
00163 typedef union {
00164     uint64_t u64;
00165     struct {
00166 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00167         cvmx_mips_space_t mem_space:2;
00168                         /**< Must CVMX_IO_SEG */
00169         uint64_t reserved:13;       /**< Must be zero */
00170         uint64_t is_io:1;       /**< Must be one */
00171         uint64_t did:8;         /**< The ID of the device on the non-coherent bus */
00172         uint64_t reserved2:4;       /**< Must be zero */
00173         uint64_t reserved3:15;      /**< Must be zero */
00174         uint64_t port:9;        /**< The hardware must have the output port in addition to the output queue */
00175         uint64_t queue:9;       /**< The output queue to send the packet to (0-127 are legal) */
00176         uint64_t reserved4:3;       /**< Must be zero */
00177 #else
00178         uint64_t reserved4:3;
00179         uint64_t queue:9;
00180         uint64_t port:9;
00181         uint64_t reserved3:15;
00182         uint64_t reserved2:4;
00183         uint64_t did:8;
00184         uint64_t is_io:1;
00185         uint64_t reserved:13;
00186         cvmx_mips_space_t mem_space:2;
00187 #endif
00188     } s;
00189 } cvmx_pko_doorbell_address_t;
00190 
00191 /**
00192  * Structure of the first packet output command word.
00193  */
00194 typedef union {
00195     uint64_t u64;
00196     struct {
00197 #ifdef __BIG_ENDIAN_BITFIELD
00198         cvmx_fau_op_size_t size1:2;
00199                          /**< The size of the reg1 operation - could be 8, 16, 32, or 64 bits */
00200         cvmx_fau_op_size_t size0:2;
00201                          /**< The size of the reg0 operation - could be 8, 16, 32, or 64 bits */
00202         uint64_t subone1:1;      /**< If set, subtract 1, if clear, subtract packet size */
00203         uint64_t reg1:11;        /**< The register, subtract will be done if reg1 is non-zero */
00204         uint64_t subone0:1;      /**< If set, subtract 1, if clear, subtract packet size */
00205         uint64_t reg0:11;        /**< The register, subtract will be done if reg0 is non-zero */
00206         uint64_t le:1;           /**< When set, interpret segment pointer and segment bytes in little endian order */
00207         uint64_t n2:1;           /**< When set, packet data not allocated in L2 cache by PKO */
00208         uint64_t wqp:1;          /**< If set and rsp is set, word3 contains a pointer to a work queue entry */
00209         uint64_t rsp:1;          /**< If set, the hardware will send a response when done */
00210         uint64_t gather:1;       /**< If set, the supplied pkt_ptr is really a pointer to a list of pkt_ptr's */
00211         uint64_t ipoffp1:7;      /**< If ipoffp1 is non zero, (ipoffp1-1) is the number of bytes to IP header,
00212                                                 and the hardware will calculate and insert the  UDP/TCP checksum */
00213         uint64_t ignore_i:1;         /**< If set, ignore the I bit (force to zero) from all pointer structures */
00214         uint64_t dontfree:1;         /**< If clear, the hardware will attempt to free the buffers containing the packet */
00215         uint64_t segs:6;         /**< The total number of segs in the packet, if gather set, also gather list length */
00216         uint64_t total_bytes:16;
00217                          /**< Including L2, but no trailing CRC */
00218 #else
00219         uint64_t total_bytes:16;
00220         uint64_t segs:6;
00221         uint64_t dontfree:1;
00222         uint64_t ignore_i:1;
00223         uint64_t ipoffp1:7;
00224         uint64_t gather:1;
00225         uint64_t rsp:1;
00226         uint64_t wqp:1;
00227         uint64_t n2:1;
00228         uint64_t le:1;
00229         uint64_t reg0:11;
00230         uint64_t subone0:1;
00231         uint64_t reg1:11;
00232         uint64_t subone1:1;
00233         cvmx_fau_op_size_t size0:2;
00234         cvmx_fau_op_size_t size1:2;
00235 #endif
00236     } s;
00237 } cvmx_pko_command_word0_t;

00265 /**
00266  * Configure a output port and the associated queues for use.
00267  *
00268  * @param port       Port to configure.
00269  * @param base_queue First queue number to associate with this port.
00270  * @param num_queues Number of queues t oassociate with this port
00271  * @param priority   Array of priority levels for each queue. Values are
00272  *                   allowed to be 1-8. A value of 8 get 8 times the traffic
00273  *                   of a value of 1. There must be num_queues elements in the
00274  *                   array.
00275  */
00276 extern cvmx_pko_return_value_t cvmx_pko_config_port(int port, int base_queue, int num_queues, const uint8_t priority[]);
00277 
00278 /**
00279  * Ring the packet output doorbell. This tells the packet
00280  * output hardware that "len" command words have been added
00281  * to its pending list.  This command includes the required
00282  * CVMX_SYNCWS before the doorbell ring.
00283  *
00284  * WARNING: This function may have to look up the proper PKO port in
00285  * the IPD port to PKO port map, and is thus slower than calling
00286  * cvmx_pko_doorbell_pkoid() directly if the PKO port identifier is
00287  * known.
00288  *
00289  * @param ipd_port   The IPD port corresponding the to pko port the packet is for
00290  * @param queue  Queue the packet is for
00291  * @param len    Length of the command in 64 bit words
00292  */
00293 static inline void cvmx_pko_doorbell(uint64_t ipd_port, uint64_t queue, uint64_t len)
00294 {
00295     cvmx_pko_doorbell_address_t ptr;
00296     uint64_t pko_port;
00297 
00298     pko_port = ipd_port;
00299     if (octeon_has_feature(OCTEON_FEATURE_PKND))
00300         pko_port = cvmx_helper_cfg_ipd2pko_port_base(ipd_port);
00301 
00302     ptr.u64 = 0;
00303     ptr.s.mem_space = CVMX_IO_SEG;
00304     ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_PKT_SEND;
00305     ptr.s.is_io = 1;
00306     ptr.s.port = pko_port;
00307     ptr.s.queue = queue;
00308     CVMX_SYNCWS;        /* Need to make sure output queue data is in DRAM before doorbell write */
00309     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, len);
00310 }
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * Prepare to send a packet.  This may initiate a tag switch to
00314  * get exclusive access to the output queue structure, and
00315  * performs other prep work for the packet send operation.
00316  *
00317  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish() MUST be called after this function is called,
00318  * and must be called with the same port/queue/use_locking arguments.
00319  *
00320  * The use_locking parameter allows the caller to use three
00321  * possible locking modes.
00322  * - CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE
00323  *      - PKO doesn't do any locking. It is the responsibility
00324  *          of the application to make sure that no other core
00325  *          is accessing the same queue at the same time.
00326  * - CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG
00327  *      - PKO performs an atomic tagswitch to insure exclusive
00328  *          access to the output queue. This will maintain
00329  *          packet ordering on output.
00330  * - CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00331  *      - PKO uses the common command queue locks to insure
00332  *          exclusive access to the output queue. This is a
00333  *          memory based ll/sc. This is the most portable
00334  *          locking mechanism.
00335  *
00336  * NOTE: If atomic locking is used, the POW entry CANNOT be
00337  * descheduled, as it does not contain a valid WQE pointer.
00338  *
00339  * @param port   Port to send it on, this can be either IPD port or PKO
00340  *       port.
00341  * @param queue  Queue to use
00342  * @param use_locking
00343  *               CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE, CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG, or CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00344  */
00345 static inline void cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare(uint64_t port __attribute__ ((unused)), uint64_t queue, cvmx_pko_lock_t use_locking)
00346 {
00347     if (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG) {
00348         /* Must do a full switch here to handle all cases.  We use a fake WQE pointer, as the POW does
00349          ** not access this memory.  The WQE pointer and group are only used if this work is descheduled,
00350          ** which is not supported by the cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare/cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish combination.
00351          ** Note that this is a special case in which these fake values can be used - this is not a general technique.
00352          */
00353         uint32_t tag = CVMX_TAG_SW_BITS_INTERNAL << CVMX_TAG_SW_SHIFT | CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_PKO << CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_SHIFT | (CVMX_TAG_SUBGROUP_MASK & queue);
00354         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_full((cvmx_wqe_t *) cvmx_phys_to_ptr(0x80), tag, CVMX_POW_TAG_TYPE_ATOMIC, 0);
00355     }
00356 }
00357 
00358 #define cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare_pkoid  cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare
00359 
00360 /**
00361  * Complete packet output. cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() must be called exactly once before this,
00362  * and the same parameters must be passed to both cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() and
00363  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish().
00364  *
00365  * WARNING: This function may have to look up the proper PKO port in
00366  * the IPD port to PKO port map, and is thus slower than calling
00367  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish_pkoid() directly if the PKO port
00368  * identifier is known.
00369  *
00370  * @param ipd_port   The IPD port corresponding the to pko port the packet is for
00371  * @param queue  Queue to use
00372  * @param pko_command
00373  *               PKO HW command word
00374  * @param packet Packet to send
00375  * @param use_locking
00376  *               CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE, CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG, or CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00377  *
00378  * @return returns CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS on success, or error code on failure of output
00379  */
00380 static inline cvmx_pko_return_value_t cvmx_hwpko_send_packet_finish(uint64_t ipd_port, uint64_t queue,
00381                                     cvmx_pko_command_word0_t pko_command, cvmx_buf_ptr_t packet, cvmx_pko_lock_t use_locking)
00382 {
00383     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t result;
00384 
00385     if (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG)
00386         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00387 
00388     result = cvmx_cmd_queue_write2(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO(queue), (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE), pko_command.u64, packet.u64);
00389     if (cvmx_likely(result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS)) {
00390         cvmx_pko_doorbell(ipd_port, queue, 2);
00391         return CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS;
00392     } else if ((result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_NO_MEMORY) || (result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_FULL)) {
00393         return CVMX_PKO_NO_MEMORY;
00394     } else {
00395         return CVMX_PKO_INVALID_QUEUE;
00396     }
00397 }
00398 
00399 /**
00400  * Complete packet output. cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() must be called exactly once before this,
00401  * and the same parameters must be passed to both cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() and
00402  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish().
00403  *
00404  * WARNING: This function may have to look up the proper PKO port in
00405  * the IPD port to PKO port map, and is thus slower than calling
00406  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish3_pkoid() directly if the PKO port
00407  * identifier is known.
00408  *
00409  * @param ipd_port   The IPD port corresponding the to pko port the packet is for
00410  * @param queue  Queue to use
00411  * @param pko_command
00412  *               PKO HW command word
00413  * @param packet Packet to send
00414  * @param addr   Plysical address of a work queue entry or physical address to zero on complete.
00415  * @param use_locking
00416  *               CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE, CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG, or CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00417  *
00418  * @return returns CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS on success, or error code on failure of output
00419  */
00420 static inline cvmx_pko_return_value_t cvmx_hwpko_send_packet_finish3(uint64_t ipd_port, uint64_t queue,
00421                                  cvmx_pko_command_word0_t pko_command, cvmx_buf_ptr_t packet, uint64_t addr, cvmx_pko_lock_t use_locking)
00422 {
00423     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t result;
00424     if (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG)
00425         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00426 
00427     result = cvmx_cmd_queue_write3(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO(queue), (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE), pko_command.u64, packet.u64, addr);
00428     if (cvmx_likely(result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS)) {
00429         cvmx_pko_doorbell(ipd_port, queue, 3);
00430         return CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS;
00431     } else if ((result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_NO_MEMORY) || (result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_FULL)) {
00432         return CVMX_PKO_NO_MEMORY;
00433     } else {
00434         return CVMX_PKO_INVALID_QUEUE;
00435     }
00436 }

00471 /**
00472  * Sets the internal FPA pool data structure for PKO comamnd queue.
00473  * @param pool  fpa pool number yo use
00474  * @param buffer_size   buffer size of pool
00475  * @param buffer_count  number of buufers to allocate to pool

00480 void cvmx_pko_set_cmd_que_pool_config(int64_t pool, uint64_t buffer_size,

00482 
00483 /**
00484  * Get the status counters for a port.
00485  *
00486  * @param ipd_port Port number (ipd_port) to get statistics for.
00487  * @param clear    Set to 1 to clear the counters after they are read
00488  * @param status   Where to put the results.
00489  *
00490  * Note:
00491  *     - Only the doorbell for the base queue of the ipd_port is
00492  *       collected.
00493  *     - Retrieving the stats involves writing the index through
00494  *       CVMX_PKO_REG_READ_IDX and reading the stat CSRs, in that
00495  *       order. It is not MP-safe and caller should guarantee
00496  *       atomicity.
00497  */
00498 void cvmx_pko_get_port_status(uint64_t ipd_port, uint64_t clear, cvmx_pko_port_status_t * status);
00499 
00500 /**
00501  * Rate limit a PKO port to a max packets/sec. This function is only
00502  * supported on CN57XX, CN56XX, CN55XX, and CN54XX.
00503  *
00504  * @param port      Port to rate limit
00505  * @param packets_s Maximum packet/sec
00506  * @param burst     Maximum number of packets to burst in a row before rate
00507  *                  limiting cuts in.
00508  *
00509  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00510  */
00511 extern int cvmx_pko_rate_limit_packets(int port, int packets_s, int burst);
00512 
00513 /**
00514  * Rate limit a PKO port to a max bits/sec. This function is only
00515  * supported on CN57XX, CN56XX, CN55XX, and CN54XX.
00516  *
00517  * @param port   Port to rate limit
00518  * @param bits_s PKO rate limit in bits/sec
00519  * @param burst  Maximum number of bits to burst before rate
00520  *               limiting cuts in.
00521  *
00522  * @return Zero on success, negative on failure
00523  */
00524 extern int cvmx_pko_rate_limit_bits(int port, uint64_t bits_s, int burst);

00526 /**
00527  * @INTERNAL
00528  *

00530  *
00531  * @param interface
00532  * @param index

00534  * @return negative on error.
00535  *
00536  * This applies only to the non-loopback interfaces.

00539 extern int __cvmx_pko_get_pipe(int interface, int index);

00542  * For a given PKO port number, return the base output queue
00543  * for the port.

00550 /**
00551  * For a given PKO port number, return the number of output queues
00552  * for the port.
00553  *
00554  * @param pko_port  PKO port number
00555  * @return      the number of output queues
00556  */

00558 
00559 /**
00560  * Ring the packet output doorbell. This tells the packet
00561  * output hardware that "len" command words have been added
00562  * to its pending list.  This command includes the required
00563  * CVMX_SYNCWS before the doorbell ring.
00564  *
00565  * @param pko_port   Port the packet is for
00566  * @param queue  Queue the packet is for
00567  * @param len    Length of the command in 64 bit words
00568  */
00569 static inline void cvmx_pko_doorbell_pkoid(uint64_t pko_port, uint64_t queue, uint64_t len)
00570 {
00571     cvmx_pko_doorbell_address_t ptr;
00572 
00573     ptr.u64 = 0;
00574     ptr.s.mem_space = CVMX_IO_SEG;
00575     ptr.s.did = CVMX_OCT_DID_PKT_SEND;
00576     ptr.s.is_io = 1;
00577     ptr.s.port = pko_port;
00578     ptr.s.queue = queue;
00579     CVMX_SYNCWS;        /* Need to make sure output queue data is in DRAM before doorbell write */
00580     cvmx_write_io(ptr.u64, len);
00581 }
00582 
00583 /**
00584  * Complete packet output. cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() must be called exactly once before this,
00585  * and the same parameters must be passed to both cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() and
00586  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish_pkoid().
00587  *
00588  * @param pko_port   Port to send it on
00589  * @param queue  Queue to use
00590  * @param pko_command
00591  *               PKO HW command word
00592  * @param packet Packet to send
00593  * @param use_locking
00594  *               CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE, CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG, or CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00595  *
00596  * @return returns CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS on success, or error code on failure of output
00597  */
00598 static inline cvmx_pko_return_value_t cvmx_hwpko_send_packet_finish_pkoid(int pko_port, uint64_t queue,
00599                                   cvmx_pko_command_word0_t pko_command, cvmx_buf_ptr_t packet, cvmx_pko_lock_t use_locking)
00600 {
00601     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t result;
00602     if (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG)
00603         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00604 
00605     result = cvmx_cmd_queue_write2(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO(queue), (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE), pko_command.u64, packet.u64);
00606     if (cvmx_likely(result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS)) {
00607         cvmx_pko_doorbell_pkoid(pko_port, queue, 2);
00608         return CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS;
00609     } else if ((result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_NO_MEMORY) || (result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_FULL)) {
00610         return CVMX_PKO_NO_MEMORY;
00611     } else {
00612         return CVMX_PKO_INVALID_QUEUE;
00613     }
00614 }
00615 
00616 /**
00617  * Complete packet output. cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() must be called exactly once before this,
00618  * and the same parameters must be passed to both cvmx_pko_send_packet_prepare() and
00619  * cvmx_pko_send_packet_finish_pkoid().
00620  *
00621  * @param pko_port   The PKO port the packet is for
00622  * @param queue  Queue to use
00623  * @param pko_command
00624  *               PKO HW command word
00625  * @param packet Packet to send
00626  * @param addr   Plysical address of a work queue entry or physical address to zero on complete.
00627  * @param use_locking
00628  *               CVMX_PKO_LOCK_NONE, CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG, or CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE
00629  *
00630  * @return returns CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS on success, or error code on failure of output
00631  */
00632 static inline cvmx_pko_return_value_t cvmx_hwpko_send_packet_finish3_pkoid(uint64_t pko_port, uint64_t queue,
00633                                    cvmx_pko_command_word0_t pko_command, cvmx_buf_ptr_t packet, uint64_t addr, cvmx_pko_lock_t use_locking)
00634 {
00635     cvmx_cmd_queue_result_t result;
00636     if (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_ATOMIC_TAG)
00637         cvmx_pow_tag_sw_wait();
00638 
00639     result = cvmx_cmd_queue_write3(CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_PKO(queue), (use_locking == CVMX_PKO_LOCK_CMD_QUEUE), pko_command.u64, packet.u64, addr);
00640     if (cvmx_likely(result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_SUCCESS)) {
00641         cvmx_pko_doorbell_pkoid(pko_port, queue, 3);
00642         return CVMX_PKO_SUCCESS;
00643     } else if ((result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_NO_MEMORY) || (result == CVMX_CMD_QUEUE_FULL)) {
00644         return CVMX_PKO_NO_MEMORY;
00645     } else {
00646         return CVMX_PKO_INVALID_QUEUE;
00647     }
00648 }
00649 
00650 /*
00651  * Obtain the number of PKO commands pending in a queue
00652  *
00653  * @param queue is the queue identifier to be queried
00654  * @return the number of commands pending transmission or -1 on error
00655  */
00656 int cvmx_pko_queue_pend_count( cvmx_cmd_queue_id_t queue);

00658 void cvmx_pko_set_cmd_queue_pool_buffer_count(uint64_t buffer_count);

00662 }
